1.text: Buy sole fillets with moist flesh and a mild scent.

2.text: Dry the fillets gently with a paper towel.

3.text: Place the flour on a large plate.

4.text: Season the sole fillets with the kosher salt.

5.text: Coat both sides of each fillet with the flour.

6.text: Melt 1 tablespoon (14 g) of butter in a large skillet.

7.text: Slice the lemon and cook the slices for 2 minutes.

8.text: Add the fillets to the skillet and cook the first side for 2 minutes.

9.text: Flip over the fillets with a spatula and cook for another 2 minutes.

10.text: Add 2 tablespoons (23.3 g) of capers and the rest of the butter to the skillet.

11.text: Plate the fillets and spoon the butter sauce over them.

12.text: Top each fillet with 1-2 browned lemon slices and serve the dish.

13.text: Purchase sole fillets that look moist and smell mild.

15.text: Combine the bread, zest, nuts, and cheese in a food processor.

16.text: Add 2 tablespoons (23.3 ml) of olive oil and process them until incorporated.

17.text: Season both sides of the fillets and put them in a casserole dish.

18.text: Melt the butter in a saucepan with the lemon juice and capers.

19.text: Top the fillets with the butter sauce and the breadcrumb mixture.

20.text: Sauté the garlic and chard over medium heat for 2 minutes.

21.text: Serve the fillets immediately with the garlic-infused chard.
